All families of students in grades K-8 that currently have Tri-Valley issued Dell Chromebooks/chargers and Verizon hot spots at home are required to return all items to the school by Friday, July 17th.

IMMUNIZATIONS REQUIRED FOR KINDERGARTEN AND 6TH GRADE ENTRY IN SOUTH DAKOTA

South Dakota Codified Law 13-28-7.1 (Rev. 2016) requires that any pupil entering school or an early childhood program in this state shall, prior to admission, be required to present to school authorities certification from a licensed physician that the child has received, or is in the process of receiving, adequate immunization against poliomyelitis, diphtheria, pertussis, rubeola (measles), rubella, mumps, tetanus, meningitis and varicella (chickenpox), according to the recommendations of the State Department of Health.

Here’s a fun one! Find more activities at the link below.

BLOW A BUBBLE MASTERPIECE
Supplies:
Bubble mixture (or make your own with one part dishwashing liquid to six parts water)
Food coloring
Large bowl
Straws
Paper
Pour bubble mixture and food coloring into the bowl so that it's about a quarter of the way full. Use the straw to blow air into the mixture - the way you might not want your kids to blow bubbles into milk. When the bubbles rise above the rim of the bowl, place a piece of paper on top and then lift off the paper carefully. Voila! A swirly colorful landscape appears on the page.
Haywood-Bird said you can expand the activity by asking kids to make predictions about what the bubble painting will look like or using the masterpiece as the background for another drawing you make together.

A CERTIFIED COPY of your child’s birth certificate

Utility Bill
Rent Receipt

Homeowner/Renter’s insurance policy

A Very Avery
November 24, 2019 at 9:56 PM ·

Sunday = Rest Day

Although, every bit of getting up and moving around for Avery is work. But every bit of it was fun for her today! She had her cousins, grandparents, sister and aunt and uncle to keep her moving and motivated! She was up and about more today than she probably has been since we’ve been here. She was having so much fun playing hide and seek that we may have gone over on her time in her wheelchair a bit. 🤷🏼‍♀️ Don’t tell the nurse! 😉

We were also able to celebrate Thanksgiving all together tonight. It was such a blessing to be together as a family. The kids had a blast and it was good to sit, eat good food and chat like we weren’t sitting in a hospital dining area.

It’s back to the grind tomorrow but her tank is full and my guess is, she’ll be ready to work!

Side note: I’ve had a couple requests for a mailing address here for Avery so I included it below! 😊 Thank you all again for all of the support! ❤️

She was having so much fun playing hide and seek that we may have gone over on her time in her wheelchair a bit. 🤷🏼‍♀️ Don’t tell the nurse! 😉

We were also able to celebrate Thanksgiving all together tonight. It was such a blessing to be together as a family. The kids had a blast and it was good to sit, eat good food and chat like we weren’t sitting in a hospital dining area.

It’s back to the grind tomorrow but her tank is full and my guess is, she’ll be ready to work!

This past spring Mrs. Ebert wrote a Donors Choose project to bring Virtual Reality into her classroom. Through donations from Tri-Valley families, friends, and community members as well as the generous donation by the Crooks Development Corporation, Mrs. Ebert was able to bring Virtual Reality to her classroom this fall.

Students had their first experience with VR this week. This lesson was on elements, atoms, and molecules. Students went on a guided expedition to better understand and “see” these abstract concepts in a new and real way.

Mrs. Ebert says, “there is so much to offer our students through technology and VR is a great way to bring the world into the classroom. It's one thing to teach our students, it's another for them to experience their learning. We are grateful for this opportunity and appreciate all that have donated to our projects and look forward to future projects through this organization.”

Tri-Valley is excited to host our Homecoming celebration week September 23rd-27th. The HS Student Council wanted to do a spoof on ROCKS since we play the Dell Rapids QUARRIERS for the football game! So the dress up days are all Dwayne "The ROCK" Johnson movies. This theme will be for all students grades Jr. K-12. Get out there and figure out your costume ideas for the week!

Moana Monday: wear your beach gear or dress up like any character from the movie

Titan Games Tuesday: put on your coolest workout gear or choose a bunch of friends and look like a team

Outta This World Wednesday: from the movie Planet 51, dress up like you're from another planet or an astronaut

Jumanji Thursday: choose to dress as your favorite character(s) from board games or video games

The Game Plan Friday: show off your Mustang spirit by wearing your maroon and white
